name: silphium trifoliatum
description: Whorled Rosin Weed is a perennial forb for full to partial shade. Its leaves attach to the stem in a 'whorled' formation (see photo). Although it shares a similar common name with Silphium integrifolium (Rosin Weed), the plants are noticeably different. Like other species of Silphium, it features large yellow composite flowers blooming late summer, similar to a sunflower.
features: Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
